Description: Bottle with a narrow neck, an everted beaded rim and a rounded base; pinkish-brown fabric with clearly visible micaceous inclusions, red slipped on the exterior. Handmade. Incomplete but with complete profile. Imported from Egypt.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site R19 Grave (3) Context 5
Type series: NDRS type J28.3 (published form type series number)
Curator's comments: Marked with KNE 2 (survey site code superceded by R19)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.288, fig. 5.19)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 252x (excavation type series number)
